author: AlexBillon07
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Hello,

I am trying to install [Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility) package from NuGet with Powershell 6.0.2 console but I always get the same exception Unable to find dependent package(s) (System.Reflection.Emit.Lightweight)

I am not sure if I report this issue in the right place so please point me in the right direction if I am mistaken.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Find-Package -Name Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility -ProviderName NuGet | Install-Package
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Installation of the package

Actual behavior
---------------
UnableToFindDependencyPackage Exception

```none
Install-Package : Unable to find dependent package(s) (System.Reflection.Emit.Lightweight)
At line:1 char:74
+ ... ft.Windows.Compatibility -ProviderName NuGet | Install-Package -Force
+                                                    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (System.Reflection.Emit.Lightweight:String) [Install-Package], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnableToFindDependencyPackage,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.InstallPackage
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.1.7601 S
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
WCP is already in PowerShell Core 6.1 - the PR was merged today.
So you get this in next preview or in release 6.1.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: For 6.0.0-6.0.2, you can use PSCoreWindowsCompat https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSCoreWindowsCompat/ if you just want to make the missing libraries loaded in powerShell.

comments.author: AlexBillon07
comments.body:
Thanks.
I'll wait for the next release of 6.1.

title: Install-Package Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility // Unable to find dependent package(s) (System.Reflection.Emit.Lightweight)
